Description: Marble stele of Isias, daughter of Metrodoros. Isias is dressed as a priestess and holds a bucket and a key. The wreath is a civic award for public service.
Production place: Made in: Smyrna, said to be from
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (639)
Inscription / The Collection of Ancient Greek Inscriptions in the British Museum (1023)
Exhibition history: 2005-2006, 26 Nov-26 Feb, Frankfurt, Liebieghaus, Egypt, Greece & Rome
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Isias, Daughter of Metrodoros
